sub_title: Msc Graduate from Rotterdam School of Management
summary:
BSc in International Business Administration and MSc in Marketing Management graduate with a global perspective and a keen interest in marketing. Holding degrees from Erasmus University Rotterdam, my academic journey was enriched by living in Panama City, Buenos Aires, Mexico City, and Rotterdam, fostering a diverse international outlook.

My academic path led me through the Rotterdam School of Management, where I completed the International Business Administration program. Specializing in Marketing Management, I successfully graduated in June 2023. 

My professional experience spans various realms. I've contributed insights to P&G's Latin American Marketing, engaged in technology risk consulting at EY Central America, and recently contributed to ScentAir EMEA, an Advertising Services firm. My experiences also highlight proficiency in various technological aspects. I've handled SEO, participated in product packaging development, conducted data analysis, managed content creation and social media, and offered strategic consulting.

Skills:
- Data Management: Proficient in data analysis and management tools such as Excel, R, Tableau, Gephi.
- SEO & Google Analytics: Experienced in optimizing digital content and analyzing website traffic.
- Multicultural Teamwork: Effective collaboration in diverse and cross-cultural environments.
- Cross-Department Collaboration: Seamless interaction across departments to achieve common goals.
- Strategic Thinking: Developing insightful strategies that merge creativity and data-driven decision-making.

With this multifaceted background, I'm excited to merge strategic thinking with technology-driven innovation. Let's connect to explore potential synergies and navigate the dynamic realm of marketing together.

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.description:
Marketing Intern based in Rotterdam, driving the launch of the new ScentAir website in Europe and facilitating the transition from B2B to B2C, with a focused impact on ScentAir Spain. My role encompassed a range of tasks and responsibilities, including:

- Developed captivating internal and external content tailored for Spanish, French, and UK markets, enhancing engagement and resonance.
- Crafted alluring packaging designs for fragrances, catering to discerning clients in Spain, Switzerland, and France.
- Managed and curated compelling content for Spanish social media channels, bolstering brand presence and engagement.
- Collaborated closely with Iberian sales teams to create bespoke design solutions aligned with customer preferences.
- Elevated the SEO of the Spanish website by curating and optimizing over 50 insightful blog entries.
- Orchestrated the management of lead databases across EMEA and APAC regions, streamlining 
   processes.
- Contributed to the generation of impactful pamphlets and meticulously designed sales slides tailored for the Spanish market.

Skills honed during this tenure:

- Teamwork: Collaborated cross-functionally to deliver comprehensive marketing solutions.
- Data Analysis: Managed lead data across diverse regions to inform strategic decisions.
- Search Engine Optimization (SEO): Enhanced website visibility through content optimization.
- Graphic Design: Created visually captivating packaging designs and marketing materials.
- Microsoft Excel: Leveraged Excel to streamline data management and analysis.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Intern

profile_positions.description:
Intern Technology Risk Consultant at EY Central America (EYCA), specializing in Supply Chain and Operations. Engaged in diverse projects spanning Costa Rica and Guatemala, my responsibilities included:

- Devising compelling pitch presentations for clients, showcasing our tailored solutions.
- Skillfully managing and organizing consumer databases, ensuring data accuracy and accessibility.
- Playing a pivotal role in advocating and demonstrating the efficacy of logistics tools to clients.

During my 3+ months at EY, I remotely collaborated from Panama with a Costa Rican team servicing an American client. Our focus was on facilitating a seamless transition to digital factura (electronic invoicing) for all transactions, achieved through an integrated system storing transaction data and customer information. Additionally, I partnered with a government agency in Guatemala, delivering strategic insights on export strategies and offshore management possibilities.

These experiences have not only expanded my knowledge but also refined key skills in client interaction, database management, and strategic analysis, enriching my holistic professional toolkit.
profile_positions.title: Technology Risk Consultant Intern

profile_positions.title: Investor

profile_positions.description:
Student Business Consultant for an enterprising entrepreneur who established a Media and Communications company in the Netherlands. My engagement encompassed:

- Conducting comprehensive market research to inform strategic decisions and drive growth.
- Collaborating with our 'client', an organization supporting refugee entrepreneurs in adapting to new business cultures. My role included identifying promising leads through extensive research, evaluating hundreds of potential clients in the region.

In addition to contributing to the success of the Media and Communications company, I took part in an altruistic endeavor assisting refugee entrepreneurs to flourish in their new business environments. This experience solidified my commitment to inclusive business development and honed my expertise in market research and client outreach.
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I had the privilege of working at P&G for a month at their Regional Headquarters for LADMAR (Latin America). During this insightful internship:

- I undertook the pivotal task of organizing a vast email database while also pitching innovative ideas to enhance data management and broaden the scope of our consumer database.
- Specifically, I was entrusted with analyzing a comprehensive database spanning over 1.7 million data points, encompassing emails and cellphone numbers across the Latin American region. My role revolved around identifying and addressing gaps in this dataset, a task I approached with precision and dedication.
- Employing Excel as my analytical tool, I meticulously examined the data, pinpointing gaps and potential areas for improvement. Leveraging my design skills, I effectively translated my findings into informative infographics, enabling a clear and visually engaging representation of the data gaps.
Furthermore, I was assigned the responsibility of identifying best-in-class practices to enhance customer data collection. I engaged with markets across Asia, Oceania, Europe, and North America, gathering insights to be analyzed and subsequently implemented in the Latin American context.

Skills Utilized:

- Data Analysis: Meticulously examined and identified gaps within a large dataset.
- Excel Proficiency: Employed Excel for in-depth data analysis and insights generation.
- Visual Communication: Leveraged design skills to create informative infographics.
- Global Collaboration: Engaged with diverse teams across continents to gather insights.
- Market Research: Researched and implemented best practices from global markets."

This multifaceted experience not only honed my analytical skills and proficiency in data management but also showcased my ability to collaborate with global teams and bridge insights from different markets for targeted implementation.
profile_positions.title: Latin American Marketing Division Student Intern
